item.title: Ireland fines Meta $264 million over 2018 Facebook data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Irish Data Protection Commission (DPC) fined Meta €251 million ($263.6M) over General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) violations arising from a 2018 personal data breach impacting 29 million Facebook accounts. [...]

item.title: Over 25,000 SonicWall VPN Firewalls exposed to critical flaws
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 25,000 publicly accessible SonicWall SSLVPN devices are vulnerable to critical severity flaws, with 20,000 using a SonicOS/OSX firmware version that the vendor no longer supports. [...]

item.title: Might need a mass password reset one day? Read this first.
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Organizations are often caught off-guard when a data breaches occurs, forcing them to quickly perform mass password resets Learn from Specops Software about some of the common mass password reset scenarios and the challenges you may face. [...]

item.title: FBI spots HiatusRAT malware attacks targeting web cameras, DVRs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI warned today that new HiatusRAT malware attacks are now scanning for and infecting vulnerable web cameras and DVRs that are exposed online. [...]

item.title: Texas Tech University System data breach impacts 1.4 million patients
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center and its El Paso counterpart suffered a cyberattack that disrupted computer systems and applications, potentially exposing the data of 1.4 million patients. [...]

item.title: Kali Linux 2024.4 released with 14 new tools, deprecates some features
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Kali Linux has released version 2024.4, the fourth and final version of 2024, and it is now available with fourteen new tools, numerous improvements, and deprecates some features. [...]

item.title: Windows kernel bug now exploited in attacks to gain SYSTEM privileges
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their systems against ongoing attacks targeting a high-severity Windows kernel vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Malicious ads push Lumma infostealer via fake CAPTCHA pages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A large-scale malvertising campaign distributed the Lumma Stealer info-stealing malware through fake CAPTCHA verification pages that prompt users to run PowerShell commands to verify they are not a bot. [...]

item.title: ConnectOnCall breach exposes health data of over 910,000 patients
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Healthcare software as a service (SaaS) company Phreesia is notifying over 910,000 people that their personal and health data was exposed in a May breach of its subsidiary ConnectOnCall. [...]

item.title: Rhode Island confirms data breach after Brain Cipher ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Rhode Island is warning that its RIBridges system, managed by Deloitte, suffered a data breach exposing residents' personal information after the Brain Cipher ransomware gang hacked its systems. [...]

item.title: New Android NoviSpy spyware linked to Qualcomm zero-day bugs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Serbian government exploited Qualcomm zero-days to unlock and infect Android devices with a new spyware named 'NoviSpy,' used to spy on activists, journalists, and protestors. [...]

item.title: Clop ransomware claims responsibility for Cleo data theft attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Clop ransomware gang has confirmed to BleepingComputer that they are behind the recent Cleo data-theft attacks, utilizing zero-day exploits to breach corporate networks and steal data. [...]

item.title: Winnti hackers target other threat actors with new Glutton PHP backdoor
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ​The Chinese Winnti hacking group is using a new PHP backdoor named 'Glutton' in attacks on organizations in China and the U.S., and also in attacks on other cybercriminals. [...]
